params.ancestorIpId: The ID of the ancestor IP asset

params.externalRoyaltyPolicy: The address of the external royalty policy

params.royaltyPolicy: The address of the royalty policy

returns._0: isWhitelisted True if the royalty policy is whitelisted

params.token: The address of the royalty token

returns._0: isWhitelisted True if the royalty token is whitelisted

onLicenseMinting(address,address,uint32,.details: Enforced to be only callable by LicensingModule

params.externalData: The external data custom to each the royalty policy
params.ipId: The ipId whose license is being minted (licensor)
params.licensePercent: The license percentage of the license being minted
params.royaltyPolicy: The royalty policy address of the license being minted

onLinkToParents(address,address[],addres.details: Enforced to be only callable by LicensingModule

params.externalData: The external data custom to each the royalty policy
params.ipId: The children ipId that is being linked to parents
params.licensesPercent: The license percentage of the licenses being minted
params.maxRts: The maximum number of royalty tokens that can be distributed to the external royalty policies
params.parentIpIds: The parent ipIds that the children ipId is being linked to

params.payerAddress: The address that pays the royalties
params.receiverIpId: The ipId that receives the royalties
params.token: The token to use to pay the royalties

setRoyaltyLimits(uint256).details: Enforced to be only callable by the protocol admin

params.accumulatedRoyaltyPoliciesLimit: The maximum number of accumulated royalty policies an IP asset can have

setTreasury(address).details: Enforced to be only callable by the protocol admin

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

whitelistRoyaltyPolicy(address,bool).details: Enforced to be only callable by the protocol admin

params.allowed: Indicates if the royalty policy is whitelisted or not
params.royaltyPolicy: The address of the royalty policy

whitelistRoyaltyToken(address,bool).details: Enforced to be only callable by the protocol admin

params.allowed: Indicates if the token is whitelisted or not

accumulatedRoyaltyPolicies(address).notice: Returns the accumulated royalty policies for a given IP asset

globalRoyaltyStack(address).notice: Returns the global royalty stack for whitelisted royalty policies and a given IP asset

hasAncestorIp(address,address).notice: Indicates if an IP asset has a specific ancestor IP asset

ipRoyaltyVaults(address).notice: Indicates the royalty vault for a given IP asset

isIpRoyaltyVault(address).notice: Indicates if an address is a royalty vault

isRegisteredExternalRoyaltyPolicy(addres.notice: Indicates if an external royalty policy is registered

isWhitelistedRoyaltyPolicy(address).notice: Indicates if a royalty policy is whitelisted

isWhitelistedRoyaltyToken(address).notice: Indicates if a royalty token is whitelisted

maxAccumulatedRoyaltyPolicies().notice: Returns the maximum number of accumulated royalty policies an IP asset can have

maxAncestors().notice: Returns the maximum number of total ancestors

maxParents().notice: Returns the maximum number of parents

name().notice: Returns the string identifier associated with the module.

onLicenseMinting(address,address,uint32,.notice: Executes royalty related logic on license minting

onLinkToParents(address,address[],addres.notice: Executes royalty related logic on linking to parents

payLicenseMintingFee(address,address,add.notice: Allows to pay the minting fee for a license

payRoyaltyOnBehalf(address,address,addre.notice: Allows the function caller to pay royalties to the receiver IP asset on behalf of the payer IP asset.

totalRevenueTokensAccounted(address,addr.notice: Returns the total revenue tokens received by a given IP asset while a given royalty policy is whitelisted. If a royalty policy is whitelisted since the beginning then the value will be equal to the total revenue tokens received over the lifetime of the IP asset. But whenever a payment is made to an IP asset while a royalty policy is blacklisted then that payment will not be accounted for that royalty policy.

totalRevenueTokensReceived(address,addre.notice: Returns the total lifetime revenue tokens received for a given IP asset
